It's time to heal the waters that sustain us. TakeAquaAction Turn your ideas into impactful solutions. Who We Are AquaAction is a binational (US & Canada) registered charity and non-profit organization founded in 2015 by the Fondation de Gaspé Beaubien, dedicated to building a water-secure future by addressing the global freshwater crisis. Confronted by the threats of climate change, drought, pollution, and overuse, AquaAction drives innovation by engaging talented individuals and activating their solutions , providing crucial support to transform ideas into market-ready technologies. The organization prioritizes bringing innovative solutions to market adoption, education and skill development , ensuring a future-ready workforce for the blue economy, and fosters public awareness through initiatives that educate and inspire individuals of all ages. Through programs like the AquaHacking Challenge , AquaNation , and AquaEntrepreneur , AquaAction connects innovators, facilitates collaboration, and accelerates the growth of water tech enterprises. With a proven track record of launching and/or supporting over 100 water tech companies, creating hundreds of jobs, and generating significant economic and environmental impact —including saving vast quantities of water and reducing carbon emissions—AquaAction is making tangible strides towards safeguarding freshwater resources for generations to come. Our Mission AquaAction empowers innovators and entrepreneurs to develop and deploy cutting-edge water technologies that drive sustainable solutions for water security. Through leadership development, coaching, and industry partnerships, we accelerate the growth of water-focused startups, foster collaboration, and champion water technology and innovation as pillars of economic resilience, environmental sustainability, and national security. Our Vision A future where innovation, entrepreneurship, and technology safeguard freshwater resources, ensuring water security for communities, industries, and ecosystems across North America and beyond. Our impact 0 + Active companies in portfolio Bi-national In the United States and in Canada > 0 % Female ​co-founders $ 0 M+ Investments received 0 + New jobs in the blue economy $ 0 M+ Annual revenue AQUAHACKING AquaHacking offers students and young professionals a unique opportunity to address critical issues related to freshwater through innovation and entrepreneurship. By developing skills and knowledge around the blue economy, you'll learn how to launch a startup that will contribute to climate resilience. You will receive mentorship, a microcredit and revolutionize the way we safeguard our most precious resource: water. Sign Up AQUA ENTREPRENEUR AquaEntrepreneur is a scale-up program for water tech enterprises & startups ready to pilot solutions or enter new markets. We facilitate the deployment of innovative water solutions in municipalities and industry to drive impact at scale. Join the Cohort SUCCESS STORIES AquaAction’s startups are at the forefront of freshwater solutions. Discover their innovative solutions and see how far they’ve come . This could be your story! Meet our changemakers Our partners We believe in the power of new technology and of the next generation of young innovators to bring a solution-focused mindset to solving some of the most pressing water issues we face in North America. National partners Regional partners Our team Soula Chronopoulos President More information Soula Chronopoulos is an accomplished leader with over 20 years of experience in executive leadership, digital transformation, and innovation. She has successfully launched startups and revitalized organizations by driving sustainable growth and strategic partnerships. As President of AquaAction, she leads national efforts to restore freshwater in North America, overseeing program development, advocacy, and team leadership. A dynamic speaker and strategist, Soula was named one of Canada’s Top 100 Female Entrepreneurs by Profit Magazine in 2012. She is a passionate advocate for youth, innovation, and climate action through collaborative, impact-driven initiatives. Oliver Anderson Vice-President of Communications & Growth Danny Veilleux Vice-President of Programs & Impact Marie-Cécile Poitevin Executive Coordinator of HR & Operations Kariann Aarup Head of Program Partnerships Anne Pascale Richardson Director, AquaHacking Challenge, AquaNation Laila Benameur Director, AquaEntrepreneur Brittany VanderBeek Director of Business Development Jean-Sebastien Gasse Director of Digital Platforms and IT Strategy Patricia Dorne Director of Coaching, AquaEntrepreneur Gabriella Munro Event & Sponsorship Manager Melanie Fontaine Senior Communications and Media Manager Jeanne Ménard Partnership Manager Daniel Corber Senior Instructional Designer Juliette Dufresne Coordinator, AquaEntrepreneur Marilou Filliol Coordinator, AquaNation Nick Trusiak Storytelling Coordinator Sophie-Catherine Huneault Marketing Campaign Coordi nator Kenza Vandenbroeck Coordinator, AquaHacking Jonathan Tang Grants and Research Specialist Will Kitchen Special Advisor Vittoria De Palma Controller Our ambassadors & youth advisory board Sophie-Catherine Huneault Margaux Provencher-Marie Merrick Marshall Starla Richardson Mohammad Zeinati Our board of directors Nan-B De Gaspé Beaubien Founding Chair, AquaAction More information Co-chair, De Gaspe Beaubien Foundation, Nan‑bowles (Nan‑b) de Gaspé Beaubien is a businesswoman and a pioneer in the advancement of family enterprise. As Founder and Chair of the de Gaspé Beaubien Family Foundation, she devotes her time to philanthropic endeavours that continue to break new ground supporting enterprising women and enterprising families, public health and environmental causes. An internationally renowned expert on the topic of family enterprise, Nan‑b is a regular speaker at global conferences and top universities worldwide. François de Gaspé Beaubien Founding Chair, AquaAction More information François de Gaspé Beaubien obtained a BA with honours from Haverford College before earning an MBA with distinction at Harvard Business School in 1989. Because of his strong academic performance, he was recruited by the Phi Beta Kappa fraternity, one of the oldest and most prestigious academic honour societies in the United States. After concluding his studies, François rose up the publishing ranks from publisher of New England Monthly magazine to eventually become President of Telemedia Publishing, Canada’s largest consumer magazine company at the time with titles ranging from TV Guide to Elle magazine. He and his team turned the organization from losses to the most profitable publishing group in Canada and he then sold that division in 2000. He and his brother oversaw the expansion of their radio division as co-CEOs to become Canada’s largest radio broadcaster, Telemedia, which they then sold in 2002. In 2003, François acquired Zoom Media, an indoor advertising company. Since he became CEO, the company has experienced tremendous growth (and focus), digitally entertaining and educating over 35 million fitness members every month across all of Canada, the USA, and the United Kingdom. He is the sole owner of Zoom. The businessman is also the co-Founder and Executive Chairman of Hivestack, a company that allows advertisers to target custom audiences digitally, based on physical world behaviors (combining the engagement of mobile devices with digital billboards). François recently sold Ayuda Media Systems, a software company utilized across 22 countries for its billboard management systems of which he was the Executive Chairman of the board. He is very involved in the industry and serves as Chairman of the board of the Digital Place Based Advertising Association (DPAA), a global initiative based out of NYC seeking to foster the growth of Digital Out Of Home (DOOH) media by bringing together market participants (media owners and tech suppliers) and educating marketers. Pierre-Marc Sarrazin Vice-President, Corporate Finance, Development & Treasurer, Ovivo More information Pierre-Marc Sarrazin is Vice-President, Corporate Finance, Development & Treasurer of Ovivo, a global provider of water and wastewater treatment equipment headquartered in Montreal. He joined Ovivo in 2011 and he currently leads the mergers and acquisitions strategy, financing, treasury operations and investor relations. Pierre-Marc cumulates close to twenty years of corporate finance and development experience for several multinational public companies, where he also actively participated in a number of strategic transactions, such as acquisitions, divestments, financing and restructuring. Pierre-Marc holds a Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance and a Master of Science in International Business from HEC Montreal. He also holds the designation of Chartered Financial Analyst. “I am involved with AquaAction because of its core mission, which contributes to two of my great passions: entrepreneurship and environmental protection. It is very rewarding to make a lasting difference through the creation and acceleration of innovative start-ups developing solutions to water-related problems.” Barrie Laver Managing Director, Head Venture Capital & Private Equity, RBC More information Barrie Laver is Managing Director, Head Venture Capital & Private Equity with Royal Bank of Canada and leads RBC Capital Partners, the bank’s VC & PE arm. Mr. Laver’s background is primarily in the venture capital industry both with RBC as well as having founded his own independent venture fund that focused on early stage technology investments. Mr. Laver has also served as CEO with companies in the technology, hospitality and manufacturing sectors and has experience on numerous private, public and not-for-profit boards. Mr. Laver is a member of CPA Canada and the Institute of Corporate Directors. Helen Sheridan Chief Human Resources Officer, 123Dentist More information Helen Sheridan is Chief People Officer at 123Dentist. Established in 2017 by dentists to help other dentists deliver exceptional patient care, it h as grown from 14 clinics in British Columbia to more than 400 partner clinics nationwide, supported by 7,000 team members and serving over two million patient visits annually. 123Dentist operates support centers in Vancouver, Toronto and Montreal. Helen has over 25 years of experience in senior HR roles across various industries and has a proven track record of building high-performance cultures and managing organizational growth. Known for her ability to build vibrant organizational cultures capable of generating exceptional business results and growth, Helen is a creative, values-based, community-centered, environmentally passionate, and entrepreneurial leader and executive coach. Most recently, Helen was the Chief Human Resources Officer at STEMCELL Technologies, Canada's largest life sciences company, where she and her team designed and executed a strategy driving high-volume recruitment, enhancing workplace culture and diversity, and building learning and talent strategies for this high growth Canadian success story. Helen previously led HR at notable companies like Crystal Decisions, 1-800-GOT-JUNK? and Finning International, contributing to their success during critical growth phases. She holds a Political Science degree and a Master's Degree in Organizational Systems, along with an Institute of Corporate Directors designation. Actively involved in her community, she serves on several boards and enjoys outdoor activities in British Columbia. Helen is married and has two adult sons. Kevin Chan Global Policy Campaign Strategies Director, Meta Platforms More Information Kevin Chan is the Global Policy Campaign Strategies Director at Meta Platforms, where he is focusing on the future of the internet, including the metaverse, AR/VR/MR, and the creator economy. In this role he is responsible for Meta's $50 million XR Research and Programs Fund, and is Meta’s representative on the World Economic Forum’s Global Collaboration Village. A former government executive and university administrator, Kevin launched Facebook’s Canadian public policy function and spent 7 years as its Head and then Director of Policy. His work fighting white nationalists made NOW Magazine’s 2019 Year In Review, and he was awarded a 2020-21 Harvard Technology and Democracy Fellowship for his leadership of Facebook’s Canadian Election Integrity Initiative. Kevin graduated from Harvard Kennedy School, the Ivey Business School and the Royal Conservatory of Music. An Action Canada Fellow, he is the recipient of the Public Service Award of Excellence, the Queen’s Diamond Jubilee Medal, and the Meritorious Service Medal. In 2022, he was elected a Fellow of the Royal Canadian Geographical Society. David Torre Owner and Principal Consultant, Center Mast More Information David has over twenty-five years of information technology and engineering experience across both the public and private sectors. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Information Technology, and a Master of Science degree in Business Intelligence. He specializes in the intersection of business technology, data, and security. David is currently the owner and principal consultant of Center Mast Consulting; a business technology strategy firm which has helped some of the most recognizable brands in the world build innovative business capabilities through automation, artificial intelligence, and data analysis. David resides in the Houston Texas metropolitan area and is an outdoorsman who joined AquaAction to protect freshwater in North America. Forbes contributors publish independent expert analyses and insights. Rachel Ingram is a reporter who covers superyachts and private jets Follow Author Jul 04, 2024, 05:35am EDT Jul 05, 2024, 04:39am EDT Share Save Comment Aqua Blu is transforming luxury expedition yachting in Indonesia Aqua Expeditions If you want to inspire Aqua Expeditions CEO and Founder Francesco Galli Zugaro, don’t tell him he’s brilliant, even though he is. Tell him he’s crazy. Tell him his ambitions are impossible. And then sit back and watch the magic happen. Galli Zugaro is a man who thrives on turning challenge into opportunity. The Italian-American has built a business operating luxury river cruises and yacht charters in some of the most complex destinations in the world – the Peruvian Amazon, the Vietnamese Mekong, the remotest Indonesian islands – onboard yachts he has had specially built. Since founding Aqua Expeditions in 2007, Galli Zugaro has created several game-changing travel propositions for “affluent explorers” and been commended for feats including launching Peru's first luxury river cruise on the Amazon River, transforming luxury expedition yachting in Indonesia with Aqua Blu , and taking the first commercial superyacht ( Aqua Mare ) to the Galapagos. And with a fleet of six boats and counting, he’s not done yet. As Aqua Expeditions prepares to announce its next project, we take a deep dive into Galli Zugaro’s greatest passions, chart his journey to success, and unveil the next steps of his master plan – which may soon be open to strategic investment. Francesco Galli Zugaro, CEO of Aqua Expeditions Aqua Expeditions Where did your passion for travel stem from? Francesco Galli Zugaro: Growing up in 16 countries put the travel bug in me. My dad was Managing Director for Latin America for Alitalia – it was in his blood to travel and this passed down to me. When my parents divorced, I started living with my mom and my stepdad; he was Bureau Chief for TIME magazine in many countries so we moved around from Germany to Lebanon to Israel to Cyprus to Italy, and so forth. After later graduating from Boston, I started working with a private equity group in South America that was investing in telecom and tourism. I ran the telecom startup for five years and then moved over to a small ship expedition investment that we made in the Galapagos. That was how I cut my teeth in travel. MORE FROM FORBES ADVISOR Best High-Yield Savings Accounts Of 2024 By Kevin Payne Contributor Best 5% Interest Savings Accounts of 2024 By Cassidy Horton Contributor What lead you to leave the private equity group and set up Aqua Expeditions ? Having left Ecuador and the investment there that we exited, I started looking around South America. Originally, I wanted to go to Argentina. There was an American gentleman called Douglas Tompkins who owned North Face and invested in buying up cattle ranches so I thought, ‘let's head out there’. On the way, I stopped at Iquitos and the Peruvian Amazon and I realise no one was doing the Amazon at a really high-end level’. I went around Iquitos with a Peruvian Navy Admiral who told me there was a 50-metre steel hull for sale around one of the tributaries. So, we took one of the Navy’s little tugboats and knocked on the shed and this guy sold it to me – I towed it away that day. I then commissioned a shipyard to obviously build it for me and brought in Jordi Puig, a very well-known Peruvian architect at the time. From buying it to launching it with heads and beds took us eight months. I don't claim to be the first, but I was the first at the top-end level catering to what I call today ‘affluent explorers’. Onboard Aqua Blu in Indonesia Aqua Expeditions Why did you pick South America to launch the business? I picked South America because I knew it. At the time, the hottest package in South America was Machu Picchu and Galapagos. Compared to Ecuador at the time, the potential growth in Peru was amazing. Orient Express had come in and has five properties and three trains so they were pumping money into promoting the destination. So, I thought, all I have to do is plug a great product in the Peruvian Amazon and it's automatically going to be packaged up into the circuit of Peru at the time. It was very easy to quickly position a top end premium product. So I sold my house in Ecuador, moved my whole family to Peru and put everything into it. It was a risk, but I have a healthy measured appetite for risk. Why did you decide to build a boat-focused business rather than enter the hotel market? Having operated in the Galapagos, I thought how cool is it that you can control the guest experience? To really curate a guest experience in a one-night stay in a hotel is very difficult – you can't really make an impact. With the whole yachting experience cruising experience, you can curate something and create really cool environment for guests. From a business perspective, these businesses are very cash rich because you can have high cash flow because people are booking ahead of time, with very few cancellations because these are long-haul aspirational trips. So, this has always been an appealing a both experiential and business opportunity. Service and hospitality is key onboard all of Aqua Expeditions' boats Aqua Expeditions Why did you decide to build 12-cabin boats, and do you have plans to create larger ships? I wanted something small. Originally the concept was to copy the idea of houseboats from Kerala put them on Amazon. I said ‘let's do four ships with two smaller cabins’, but when I ran the numbers, it wasn't scalable – the more you grow, the more fixed costs you have. Whereas on a 12-cabin ship, you can have 24 guests, but the economies of scale, as soon as you break even, become super attractive because our variable costs are very low. The only variable costs are the additional food and additional guides; the fuel and the operation are still fixed. Secondly, the guest experience has to be dictated by small groups. These are trips with a high level of engagement to the the connection with the guides is key. We will never do anything that's above four couples to a guide – that allows you really to have an opportunity to engage, and the guide can tailor the excursions to that group. You can’t accomplish something so unique with a 100-guest ship. Francesco Galli Zugaro in front of luxury river boat Aqua Mekong Quan light-writer Photography How many of your ships are private charters versus tour operator bookings? About a quarter of our business is private charter. Today, all of our ships operate 48 weeks. We have 30% charters, so about 15 charters a year, and most of them are private, but a lot of them are tour operator buyouts. So, in other words, a client comes in, buys out the ship for the week, and then resells it under their brand, because they package that up with a week in Siem Reap or Ho Chi Minh. On private charters, what happens a lot is that we have two principal clients paying and it was hard for them to figure out who gets that top owner suite. So, in our river ships we have three suites which are very similar and very large. We've done that on all the ships, and that's allowed us to appeal very well to a private charter client. Why did you choose to focus your business on areas that are more complex than others? I just like the challenge. I like the feeling of accomplishment when I’ve been told many times ‘no it’s impossible, or no, you’re crazy,’ and then I showcase that it can be done. It just requires a vision and the capacity to execute. What initially started off as a vision is today a realization of 300 talented individuals that are working with me, from crew to management. I like a challenge; I don't like to take the easy way out. My biggest enjoyment comes from seeing guests appreciate what we've done. Raja Ampat Aqua Expeditions Aqua Blu is redefining luxury expedition cruising in Indonesia . What lead you to operate in this destination? I liked Indonesia you still feel like you're exploring. Galapagos in comparison is very structured. It's an amazing guest experience, but it's very regimented. In Indonesia, you can go exploring to see volcanoes, find dragons and birds-of-paradise, sail around Raja Ampat and the Spice Islands, and see what nature throws at you. That excites me, even though it's very difficult to get the permits. It look me two years to get the permits to flag in Indonesia, but I want to bring guests to see these parts of the world that are logistically complicated, and do it at a very high level. What are your guests looking for, and how do you match destinations to meet their expectations? If you talk to our guests, they've done everything. They're looking for something cool, different and relaxed. They want the world-class service but they're not pretentious so they're willing to walk barefoot and let their hair down. And a destination has to check their boxes in terms of nature and wildlife. I chose the Vietnamese Mekong because it’s an iconic river connected to two iconic World Heritage sights – Siem Reap and Angkor Wat. And then I decided to operate in three marine biosphere reserves – Galapagos, Raja Ampat and Komodo – which are on everybody's bucket list. The next destinations will have a combination of that; they'll have either iconic rivers of the world or iconic coastal cruising that will provide a wildlife and nature component, and sometimes even a cultural component. Private beach sundowners at Komodo National Park Aqua Expeditions What are your long-term plans for the company? I've got a very clear map of exactly where I'm going to put ships. Pretty much true to form, I've delivered one every three years. Next year will be my 18th year and I'll be delivering my sixth ship. The details of where how and where will be revealed later this year. I've scouted the destinations and built itineraries – that's what I do on my off-time; I spend weeks and months scouting different bodies of water all over the world. That's my passion; finding new logistically complex destinations that I think I could venture into; raising the capital to finance the ships, because these are getting more and more expensive; and building unique itineraries. What opportunities are there for interested investors? This is a very profitable business because of our fixed costs. As long as you break even, profit could be in the range of somewhere around 50%. This year we’re going to exceed our forecast and forward bookings for 2025 are very strong already. From an investor point of view, I've obviously retained control of the business and continue to do so. It doesn't mean that that will continue to be the case in the future. I'm open minded to see if I can add value strategically from a strategic partner – I have access to capital, but that strategic capital is something that I'm looking for in the future so that I can strategically roll out my business faster, and maybe have an opportunity to bring passenger flow to us faster, rather than organically growing. There aren’t that many Aquas around. We’re the only business that has this size, this niche, this reach. The day Aqua goes out to market to find that strategic partner, I think it’s going to attract a lot of eyes that want to get into that space. What about the wildlife at Cosmeston Lakes? A detailed ecological assessment, undertaken by local firm Acer Ecology, has confirmed that the seasonal Aqua Park at Cosmeston Lakes Country Park will have no significant negative impact on local birdlife or water vole populations. The Aqua Park will be situated away from sensitive bird nesting areas, further reducing any potential for disruption. The eastern lake, already supports a range of recreational activities such as paddleboarding, sailing, dog walking and scuba diving. The study shows that bird species in the area are already well adapted to this level of human activity. Many common bird species show high tolerance to disturbance and are unlikely to be affected by the seasonal operation of the inflatable water park, which are temporary structures. Extensive surveys and habitat assessments on water voles where carried out, which found that the area proposed for the Aqua Park has limited suitability for water voles. The park will be located on open shoreline lacking the vegetation that water voles rely on, and no signs of burrows or active vole presence were found in that specific zone. As such, the risk of harming water vole populations is considered negligible. The parks SSSI status is there because of one species of rare underwater plant, starry stonewart, which is only found in the western lake, the eastern lake is formally designated as suitable for recreational activity. The seasonal nature of the attraction, combined with safeguards, that the Aqua Park can operate safely and responsibly whilst maintaining the park’s wildlife conservation goals. What’s the water quality like at Cosmeston Lakes? Your safety is our top priority. The Aqua Park only opens when water quality meets recognised safety standards and conditions are safe for activities to take place. During the spring of 2025, a professional scuba diving team has surveyed the lakebed where the Aqua Park is located, in conjunction with a bathymetric depth survey, to confirm that there are no objects under the surface and that the water depth is suitable (3m – 12m). Our water samples are tested and analysed by Public Heath Wales at their UKAS-accredited laboratory. We take two samples at the same time and from the same location on the Aqua Park, which are tested side by side. This helps us identify any potential sampling or laboratory errors, as the two results should be very close to each other. For transparency, the graphs shown on our website display the average of the two results. Our closure policy is precautionary and always based on the worst result . We have been taking samples twice a week during the 2025 bathing season to ensure water quality remains safe. Two key indicators are tested: E. coli Intestinal Enterococci These bacteria occur naturally in the gut of humans and animals. Most strains are harmless, but high levels can indicate pollution and may pose a risk if swallowed. We follow guidance given directly to us by Swim England , who have stated that there should be no swimming when results are above the levels below. These are the same fail levels as World Aquatics and The Aqua Park Association, following national and international governing bodies 1,000 CFU/100ml for E. coli 400 CFU/100ml for Intestinal Enterococci Aqua Park Sessions may only resume once subsequent testing has shown results are below these thresholds .We also adopt many of the principles of the World Aquatics testing regime , alongside the requirements of our own industry body, the Aqua Park Association , which accredits Aqua Parks across the UK. These same standard levels are applied across the country to a wide range of open water recreational activities, from Aqua Parks to open water swimming and even designated inland bathing waters. The graphs show bacteria levels over time, measured in colony-forming units (CFU) per 100ml . The red line shows the Fail threshold. Beneath the red is considered Good Quality The green line shows the Excellent threshold. All our results from the 2025 bathing season are published here. To date, the water has consistently met the standards required for safe bathing. Where is Cosmeston Lakes Aqua Park? Preventing Illness & Infections from swimming in open water: What can be done to reduce the risks? The risk of contracting a serious illness is low, but by taking sensible precautions, the risk of infection can be further reduced. You should: – Cover any cuts with a waterproof dressing; – Wear footwear to protect feet from cuts; – Avoid ingesting (drinking) the water; – Wash your hands, especially before eating and drinking, with liquid soap and fresh water. You can do this immediately after the activity, at one of the hand-wash stations provided. Wash or shower when you get home. What should I do if I feel unwell after visiting the Aqua Park? In all open freshwater in the UK, there is a very low risk of catching infections, diseases and or infections. If you feel unwell after visiting Aqua Park, then please email us to let us know, especially if you are experiencing vomiting and diarrhoea, as soon as you can. Rain : You can still take part in the rain- you are going to get wet anyway ! The Aqua Park is great fun in the rain! Wind: Wind speed and direction at our venues is continuously monitored through a dedicated weather station installed on-site. Real-time data will be accessible to staff responsible for enforcing this policy. When the weather station records wind speeds consistent with or exceeding Beaufort Force 6 for a sustained period, the park will be closed. Thunder and Lightening: Safety First: The safety of all visitors is of utmost importance. When thunder and lightning are observed over the water, all activities will be temporarily stopped to ensure the safety of participants and staff. 20-Minute Wait: Activities will only resume after a visual confirmation that the storm has passed. Once the last lightning strike over the water has occurred, a mandatory waiting period of 20 minutes will be enforced before activities can resume. This waiting period is essential to ensure the safety of all involved. Constant Monitoring: Throughout the waiting period and the resumption of activities, weather conditions will be continuously monitored. If thunder and lightning resume during this period, the 20-minute wait period will reset, and activities will remain on hold until another 20 minutes have passed without any lightning strikes. Individual Consideration: The impact on ticket holders will be assessed on an individual basis in respect of refund and credits. Notification : Aqua Park Group reserve the right to cancel or reschedule Your Session at any time when reasonably required with no prior notice due to severe weather. We will inform You as soon as reasonably possible if We need to cancel or reschedule Your Session. Participating in water sports activities at the Aqua Park is vigorous and physically demanding. Please check the entry requirements to ensure that the activity is suitable on an individual basis and seek professional medical advice before booking. For proof of disability, please provide any ONE of the following forms of documentation: Entitlement to Disability Living Allowance for children under 16 or DLA/Personal Independent Payments (PIP) for those aged 16-64, either in the form of a letter stating that the benefit has been awarded, or the actual Allowance book Attendance Allowance or Carer’s Allowance letter of award Incapacity Benefit books, or a letter notifying the recipient that the benefit has been awarded Incapacity Benefit or Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) A valid Blue Badge In the case of visual impairment, a registration card known as the BD8 or a Certificate of Visual Impairment (CVI) A local authority registration document which is local to the attraction where it is being submitted (e.g an RCC Carer’s Passport) Credibility’s Access Card Once we receive your application our team will review your supporting documents. This is not the same as other decision-making systems you may be used to such as claiming disability benefits. For this reason, the threshold for making decisions is high and each adjustment we consider must have an appropriate description of need and supporting evidence. I’m differently-abled, can I take part? We welcome visits by differently-abled people to the Aqua Park and endeavour to do all that is possible to provide a safe and enjoyable experience for all. If any Attendees have any special requirements, You should inform us of this before placing an Order. Participating in water sports activities at the Aqua Park is vigorous and physically demanding. Please check the entry requirements to ensure that the activity is suitable on an individual basis and seek professional medical advice before attending. Please see our accessibility page for more information. Are there any concessions for NHS, Military, blue light? The discount available to Blue light / NHS and military service personnel is FREE wetsuit hire saving you up to 25%. Max redemption = 4 suits per booking) Alternatively, you can receive a £5 discount from our sales wetsuit where we provide them. There is no discount on tickets or annual passes currently. This is an on-the-day offer only . If you have paid for hire online in advance no refund is given, so please just reserve your tickets online and bring your work card with you to redeem this at the Ticket Office. Other OFFERS are available to our partners, check out the offers page for more information. Raffle prizes and donations? Each month our organisation receives dozens of approaches and donation applications. In view of the growing number of requests we receive, we have now created a short guide to our donations policy – the scope of which is to provide background on the cause(s) we support and how we will consider all future requests. Overall Policy Aqua Parks Group seeks to contribute to the communities in which we live and work in a number of ways. In addition to providing employment opportunities and minimising our environmental impact, we aim to provide individuals and families with the opportunity to get fit and enjoy outdoors Watersports activities. We would like to be able to donate to all of the worthy registered charities that contact us, but the high demand inevitably means we have to limit our donations. We have decided that In order to achieve the best effect we will focus on a single charity of choice over a two-year cycle and we will review our policy each year to monitor impact and effect. 2023-2025 period – please note that we have selected a charity as a focus of all of our donations and this charity is Above Water, as a result, no further donations of any kind will be considered. For more information on what Above Water Responsibility for the coordination of sponsorship lies with the Directors of The Aqua Parks Group. The donations fund is therefore focussed on registered charitable organisations that: Work across the community close to operational sites and/or have connections to the industry in which we operate. What we fund We will only consider applications from charities and non-profit organisations that demonstrate how a donation will enhance the well-being or safety of people through improved /health/welfare or environment. Your organisation must be a registered charity and working in: Health Education and wellbeing Environment-based or working in or around our area of operation. What we will not fund Individuals who are looking for sponsorship for fundraising activities of any type of political organisation and campaigns or any initiative that is outside of the criteria outlined above. How to apply If your organisation and proposed funding initiative fit our criteria please submit your donation request by email to cs@aquaparkgroup.co.uk We are unable to respond to applications sent via post. Timescales We review applications once every two years. The next meeting will be in December 2023. To submit a donation request on behalf of your chosen event or cause, please tell us a little about your cause and your intended use of any donation we make. If you have a letter confirming your status from the Charity Commission, stating that it is a registered charity, this should also be submitted to us. What is your photography policy? Thanks for your message regarding photography at the Aqua Park. Unless it is expressly prohibited, you are permitted to take photographs and recordings at the Aqua Park provided that these are solely for private use and are not sold or used for any commercial or public purpose. By accepting these Entry Conditions, you acknowledge that Aqua Park Group may request access to photographs taken and video footage captured by you. If they are deemed to be offensive to or infringe the privacy of other guests and/or staff we will request that they are deleted. By accepting these Entry Conditions, you agree not to intentionally photograph and/or capture video footage of any individual without that person’s permission and you must adhere to all photography/filming restrictions in place from time to time whilst at the Park. From time to time Aqua Park Group or other authorised parties carry out photography and/or video recording which may feature Attendees. Entry to the Aqua Park is deemed acceptance of these Entry Conditions, and you, therefore, agree that Aqua Park Group or any authorised Third Parties, partners and or Media may use such images in perpetuity in any promotional, advertising or publicity material in any format whatsoever. (However, you may object to such use by specific request to cs@aquaparkgroup.co.uk ) Waivers? Waivers must be completed by all attendees , or their parent/guardian if they are under 18, before arriving on site . Any waivers completed at the Ticket Office will be charged a £5 administration charge. The link to this is found in your order confirmation or website menu. Can I cancel or move my booking? You can reschedule your Ticket Booking online at no extra cost provided your Session is more than 7 days away. Create an online account to manage your booking. 1. Login 2. Go to my tickets tab using the ticket icon 3. view upcoming bookings 4. click view details: Click Reschedule 5. Select a new date and time, do not add additional tickets to the basket. 6. Scroll down to Re-schedule 1 item: click checkout 7. Update booking without further payment All bookings are non-refundable. We endeavour to assist all of our visitors, a ‘best effort’ policy applies to rescheduling requests under 7 days’ notice and there are no guarantees changes can be made at short notice. If you are unable to attend, please contact our customer service team on customerservices@aquaparkgroup.co.uk , and they will process your cancellation. How do I add tickets to my booking? To add more tickets to your booking, simply book the required amount of tickets online under a new booking. You do not have to do this on the same account. As long as all tickets are booked for the same time and date session, you will all attend as a group. Or you can Create an online account to manage your booking. Login Go to my tickets tab using the ticket icon view upcoming bookings click view details: Click edit add additional tickets / items to the basket. Click checkout Update booking by making the payment All bookings are non-refundable. Do you offer a Group Discount? Yes, Group discounts are available for groups and Schools with 10 or more people. Check the group bookings page for more information! Can I bring my waterproof camera? YES : all cameras, such as GoPro’s, MUST be secured by a chest harness or small handheld mount. No neck straps or selfie sticks are permitted. We cannot be held responsible for any lost devices – wearing a camera is at your own risk. If lost, the water is very deep in excess of 6m in places, and the camera will not be found. What are the terms and conditions of Season Passes? Wetsuit hire is not included with season passes at Rutland and Lakeside. Wetsuit hire is included with season passes at Cosmeston Lakes. You are able to book a maximum of x2 free bookings per week , per season pass holder. Season pass holders are allocated a select number of tickets at every session start time we have available (every 20 minutes) You are able to book Seasonaire 1hr or 2hr seasonaire sessions only, general admission tickets sold separately. Additional advance bookings can be made at the general admission price. If you wish to visit again for free on the same day please check availability with reception upon arrival. (free double ups*) On your first visit, we will take profile photos and assign them to your account . Each season pass is personal and only the person in the photo ID on the account will be able to use it. The sharing of season passes with others will result in the termination of your pass without a refund. We encourage all visitors to respect this rule for the benefit of all our guests. Season passes are non transferable – photo ID checks will be made at reception before tickets are issued. If you have booked on behalf of someone else then your season pass(es) will be cancelled without refund and you will be subject to the charge of the general admission price at the ticket office. If you are unable to attend please contact us or cancel your booking via your online account Failure to attend more than 3 bookings without cancelation will result in your season pass being cancelled without refund. If we are unable to fulfil your booking for any unforeseen reason you will be able to rebook into another session. No refunds or credits will be considered . The week runs 00:01 Sunday – 23:59 Saturday. Season passes are personal and non-transferable, just like a gym membership! Season passes must be purchased for your ‘home’ location; The Aqua Park location you will visit the most. Season passes cannot be used alongside group and school bookings in conjunction with group discounts and offers. When are the season passes valid? The passes are valid for the whole summer season across all our locations during the calendar year they are purchased in. Our season runs from May through September and opening times may vary, please see the bookings page for opening times. Usage Limits : You are able to book or attend a maximum of 2 FREE bookings per week , per season pass holder. The week runs 00:01 Sunday – 23:59 Saturday. Season passes are personal and non-transferable, just like a gym membership! How do I redeem my season pass? Once you’ve purchased your pass(es), you’ll be sent your personal season pass code that you can use to redeem on Seasonaire sessions. Season pass holders are allocated a select number of tickets at every session start time we have available (every 20 minutes). Season passes are not redeemable on general admission tickets. You can buy multiple passes from one account so managing a family pass is easy. On your first visit to the Aqua Park, our team will set up profile photos for the seasonaires at reception. Each pass is personal and non-transferable, much like a gym membership. Wetsuit hire is not included in the season pass. What does being a standard or SUPER season pass holder give you? A season pass gives you admission to the 3 of the UK’s Ultimate Aqua Park locations for a whole season full of thrills and spills! As a standard season pass holder ( seasonaire as we like to call them) you can book Seasonaire 1hr sessions on any day we are open, at any 3 locations for FREE! As a SUPER season pass holder (super seasonaire ) you can book Seasonaire 2hr sessions on any day we are open, at any 3 locations for FREE! Usage Limits : You are able to book or attend a maximum of 2 FREE bookings per week , per season pass holder. The week runs 00:01 Sunday – 23:59 Saturday. Season passes are personal and non-transferable, just like a gym membership! Season pass holders are allocated a select number of tickets at every session start time we have available (every 20 minutes) Wetsuit hire is included free for Cosmeston Lakes Season pass holders , as wearing personal wetsuits is not permitted. When are Peak / Off Peak ticket times? Peak = Saturdays, Sundays, Bank holidays. Off Peak = Monday – Friday. Who needs to complete a Waiver? Everyone attending the Aqua Park must complete a waiver prior to arrival for your session! Waivers must be completed by all attendees, or their parent/guardian if they are under 18 , before arriving on site. Any waivers completed at Ticket Office will be charged a £5 administration charge. The link to this is found in your order confirmation/website menu. Wetsuits: Do I have to wear a wetsuit? Do I have to wear a wetsuit? Wearing a wetsuit is highly recommended, they provide UV protection from the sun and a low risk of friction burns. Alternatively, you can wear suitable swimwear or gym shorts/leggings to protect you on slides and cover your shoulders with a t-shirt or rash vest. We may ask that they are required when the water temp or weather is cooler. Cost? When you book, and pay for your ticket, wetsuit hire is NOT included. There is no price reduction. You can purchase one online before your visit. Wetsuit hire can be pre-booked online – if you choose not to wear it on the day no refund is given. Wetsuit hire costs more on the day. You are welcome to bring your own wetsuit if you are attending Rutland Water and Thurrock Lakeside only. Personal wetsuits and wetsuit boots/ wetshoes use is not permitted at Cosmeston Lakes. If using an Aqua Park wetsuit, you must wear swimwear underneath for hygiene reasons. Sizes? We have Adult and Youth size wetsuits from age 6 to XXXXL adults. Only wetsuit boots or barefoot are permitted on the park. If you choose to go barefoot on the park, we recommend wearing shoes / flip flops on the shore before and after your session that you do not mind getting wet. Where can I store my belongings? Lockers are available at the park. They require a small combination padlock to lock them, you are welcome to bring your own. Alternatively, they can be purchased at Reception. We advise that you secure all your belongings and valuables, we accept no responsibility for any items left unattended. What do I wear or bring with me? Arrive in your swimwear 30 minutes before your session start time. We recommend preparing for a day out at the beach! Recommended packing list: A beach Towel or a changing robe. A change of clothes. A small padlock for our lockers (like gym/leisure centre lockers) flip flops/sliders/Crocs or old trainers you don’t mind getting wet to walk around the site in to protect your feet. A water bottle to stay hydrated. Suncream. Hand sanitiser. Picnic blankets and or camping chairs if you’re spectating. Note, personal wetsuit use is not permitted at Cosmeston Lakes. What time should I get there? Arrive at least 30 minutes before your session starts, this will allow you to check-in and change. We ask that just your group leader checks the group in. You only need your confirmation email – please help us reduce our waste as there is no need to print anything. Please note it is your responsibility to arrive on time, please get travel information and plan your visit with any local events or bank holidays in mind . If in doubt, allow extra time! If for any reason, you miss your session. We will not refund you but will try our best to accommodate you on another session. However, we cannot guarantee there is availability. What are the ages, parental supervision, swimming ability and admissions criteria? Swimming Ability It is a requirement than you can swim 25m unaided and you should be confident in the water as are likely to go underwater. You have to be able to pull yourself up out of the water, and it can be tiring. Height Restriction There is a minimum height of 1.20m permitted on the Aqua Park. There is no weight restriction. Age: Rutland and Lakeside: Open to children aged 6 + Age: Cosmeston Lakes: Open to children aged 8 + Parental Supervision Rutland and Lakeside: Open to children aged 6 and 7 years old can attend any session provided that an adult or guardian of 18+ is supervising them on the Aqua Park at all times, on a 1 adult to 3 children ratio . Children aged 8 to 15 years old inclusive must have either an over 18 adult/guardian supervising and observing from the shore , or on the Aqua Park with them for the duration of the session. 16 years old and over can attend any session without supervision. Parental Supervision Cosmeston Lakes : Children aged 8 to 15 years old inclusive must have either an over 18 adult/guardian supervising and observing from the shore , or on the Aqua Park with them for the duration of the session. 16 years old and over can attend any session without supervision. How do I Book? All bookings can be made online in advance via the website, click book a splash and follow the instructions. (note tickets go on sale in April, only gift cards are available online until then) If there appears to be nothing available on the day you want to book, it is because all sessions are taken/the park is closed on this date. Please remember before booking that all ticket sales are final . All bookings must be made online in advance to avoid disappointment. Once you have booked, you must ensure that you and/or your party have completed their waiver online before arriving . Simply follow the instructions sent in the confirmation email. If you do not complete the waiver online and have to complete one at the Ticket Office, there will be a £5 administration charge. Close Location Select a Location Rutland Thurrock Lakeside Cosmeston Lakes Take me there Close Locations Lakeside Cosmeston Lakes Rutland Shop Cardiff Shop Lakeside Shop Rutland Shop FAQs Groups Season Passes Waiver Offers Careers About Us Safety Briefing Above Water School Booking Contact Us About Us Started by the James family at Rutland Water in 2016. As enthusiastic waterskiers and wakeboarders, spending family time at the lake enjoying activities both on and in open water is engrained in our family values. We wanted to create a place for families to share our core values of enjoying time spent on the water, sharing laughs, and making memories together. Fast forward to now and this original vision is still anchored at the heart of everything we do. Over the years thousands of friends, families, teams, and colleagues have visited our Aqua Parks. All of whom have shared laugh-out-loud memories and conquered a physical challenge, helping restore people’s mental and physical health and boost their well-being. Whilst the team has now grown to 3 UK locations and over 150 employees, our strong ethos and family values remain. Our senior management team are passionate about Water safety and providing the best visitor experiences we can offer! Our teams Our Mission To provide a 5 star experience that is fun and challenging for all our customers in an environment in which they feel safe and respected. Our Values Adventure Respect Inclusivity Safety Enjoyment Camaraderie Our Vision Groups, families, adults, children, and adrenaline junkies alike have been drawn to watersports for generations. What we do out on the water has changed over the years, but the core values of enjoying time spent on the water, sharing laughs, making memories, and forging bonds between them haven’t. Fast forward to now and this original vision is still anchored at the heart of everything we do. Over the years thousands of friends, families, teams, and colleagues have visited our Aqua Parks. All of whom have shared endless laughs and conquered a physical challenges, helping restore people’s mental and physical health and boost their wellbeing. We are always looking for ways to lead the Aqua Park industry by improving safety standards, investing in our people, improving visitor experience, and designing bespoke equipment. How to find us: From the North: Leave the M6 at Junction 19 taking the A556 towards Manchester and Airport. Then follow the A56 towards Manchester City Centre through Altrincham and into Sale (approx. 10 miles). Crossgate House is on the A56 in the centre of Sale. Once you see Sainsbury’s on the right hand side, simply turn left at the traffic lights into Atkinson Road, and then immediately left into the Crossgate House car park. From the South: Leave the M60 at Junction 7 and take the A56 towards Sale and Altrincham. After about ½ mile, move into the right hand lane ready to turn right before the junction into Park Avenue. Then take the first left into York Avenue, and then left into Atkinson Road. The entrance into the Crossgate House car park is then immediately on your right. From Sale Metrolink Station: Sale Metrolink is the closest stop to Crossgate House. Upon exiting the station, take a left, follow the road round the side of Sale Town hall and to the left. You will pass Sainsbury’s on your left and Crossgate House is directly across the main road (Cross Street). It means all the training you do to prepare for the next race. It means sacrifice and commitment. It means meeting friends, having fun and swimming safely in a qualified championship. The International Arena AquaChallenge Swimming Championship is preparing to be a championship where all your efforts can be rewarded. Together with our supporters, we are striving to make this championship a great experience for everyone and to prepare a safe and competitive championship for all of you.
